p.s: After the decision of the judge is announced Starr wants to show her disappointment, so she, Chris, DeVante and Seven come to the neighbourhood to demonstrate their anger.
The first demonstration runs out of control and its participants begin to riot.
Starr and the three boys try to leave with Seven's car, but they run out of gas.
They walk on foot and meet and peaceful demonstration.
Its participants point black hairbrushes into the air, as a symbol of why Khalil got shot.
Starr recognizes her lawyer Ms. Ofrah, the member of Just Us for Justice, standing on a police car and shouting into a bullhorn.
Starr is moved back and mixes the past with the present.
After she remembers the shots by Officer Cruise, she is brought back.
That moment Ms. Ofrah recognizes Starr in the crowd and asks her if she wants to fight with her voice.
Starr agrees and is set on top of the car.
Ofrah gives her the bullhorn and Starr thinks its effect is like one of a weapon.
At first Starr is anxious, but after a cop says demonstrators need to exit the street immediately her fear gives way to anger and new courage.
She introduces herself to the crowd and says that this demonstration is about that Khalil lived and his life mattered, not about how Khalil died.
